message.content:
<<<api>>>: DataOutputStream.write
<<<code>>>: private void writeFileToInternalStorage(ArrayList<String> list, String fileName, Context context) {
    BufferedWriter writer;
    try {
        ContextWrapper cw = new ContextWrapper(context);
        File directory = cw.getDir("SMSMonitor", Context.MODE_PRIVATE);
        if (!directory.exists()) {
            directory.mkdir();
        }
        File file = new File(directory, fileName);
        writer = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(file));
        writer.write("ID, Date, Body, Phone Number");
        writer.write("\n");
        for (String s : list) {
            writer.write(s);
            writer.write("\n");
        }
        writer.write("\n");
        writer.flush();
        writer.close();
    } catch (IOException e) {
        e.printStackTrace();
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: Here is the corrected code to write a text file to internal storage. The issue with the original code was that the directory was being created as a file instead of a directory. Additionally, the file was not being created correctly. The corrected code creates the directory if it doesn't exist, creates the file within the directory, and writes the contents to the file.
